de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator

Class AbstractListDecorator<DataType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewHolderAdapter
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator.AbstractDecorator
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator.AbstractListDecorator<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListDecorator, SelectableListDecorator

    public abstract class AbstractListDecorator<DataType>
extends AbstractDecorator
    An abstract base class for all decorators, which should allow to customize the appearance of the view, which is used to visualize the items of a ListAdapter, SingleChoiceListAdapter or MultipleChoiceListAdapter.
    Since:
    0.2.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractListDecorator

        public AbstractListDecorator()

    • Method Detail

      • getViewType

        public int getViewType(@NonNull
                       DataType item)
        The method which is invoked in order to retrieve the view type of a specific item, which is about to be visualized. This method has to be overridden by custom decorators which should be able to visualize some items optically divergent from others, returning a different integer constant for each type.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be visualized, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The view type of the item, which is about to be visualized, as an Integer value

      • getViewTypeCount

        public int getViewTypeCount()
        Returns the number of view types, which are used by the decorator in order to visualize items. This method has to be overridden by custom decorators in order to return a value, which is consistent with the implementation of the getViewType-method.
        Returns:
        The number of view types, which are used by the decorator in order to visualize items, as an Integer value

      • inflateView

        public final android.view.View inflateView(@NonNull
                                           android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                           @Nullable
                                           android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                           @NonNull
                                           DataType item)
        The method which is invoked by an adapter to inflate the view, which should be used to visualize a specific item.
        Parameters:
        inflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the view, as an instance of the class LayoutInflater. The inflater may not be null
        parent - The parent view of the view, which should be inflated, as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if no parent view is available
        item - The item, which should be visualized, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The view, which has been inflated, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • onInflateView

        @NonNull
public abstract android.view.View onInflateView(@NonNull
                                                         android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                         int viewType)
        The method which is invoked, when a view, which is used to visualize an item, should be inflated.
        Parameters:
        inflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the view, as an instance of the class LayoutInflater. The inflater may not be null
        parent - The parent view of the view, which should be inflated, as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if no parent view is available
        viewType - The view type of the item, which should be visualized, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The view, which has been inflated, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
